intro: Cerastium decalvans subsp. orbelicum, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It is often found in mountainous areas of the Alps and Carpathian ranges. Due to its habitat preferences, it is relatively rare and considered a specialist species in its ecosystem.
